result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Knoeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:45 p.m. Defendant Anthony James Knoeck in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by the DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given. Motion by Atty Szilagyi to reopen and dismiss the companion citation. No objection by ADA Anderson. 16TR910 - The Court vacates the judgment previously imposed and enters dismissal and read in of the citation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Anthony James Knoeck in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:21 p.m. Defendant Anthony James Knoeck in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $250 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting $150 Cash Bond. Court orders $250 Cash Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
